alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 1:26PM MST until August 27 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 125 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across areas of Yavapai County including Bumble Bee. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bumble Bee. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 248 and 256. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... North Fork Rock Creek, Sycamore Creek, Government Spring Wash, Antelope Creek, Castle Creek, Agua Fria River, Larry Creek, Badger Spring Wash, Black Canyon, Turkey Creek, Poland Creek and Tank Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
